lines.text:
[referring to Doris]
It's very trying to have a woman at a business conference.

[ridiculing the uniformed cattle police]
Hey, mister, settle a bet. Do you work for the local funeral parlor?

[snarling]
Yeah! I bury clowns like you.

[an unpleasant prospective adoptive parent solely interested in getting a young boy to do manual labor]
Well, I guess you ain't got nuthin' wrong with yuh. Can you cut wood?

[taking an immediate dislike for the adopter, he chooses to ridicule him]
No! Can you? How often do you take a bath? Do you brush your teeth every morning? Do you know the Lord's Prayer? Do you go to church every Sunday morning?

[taking umbrage at the open disrespect]
You looka here, young fella...

[comtinuimg his tirade]
How much s seven times six?

[turning to Doris to further mock the adopter]
See for yourself! He won't do!

[as Bobby runs way, he runs after him in pursuit]
Come back here you...!

[on stage with an audience]
Well, Elmer, how do you feel?
This is the opera house. Whatta yuh think of it.?
It ain't so hot. Kinda smells bad in places - especially back there where Mr. Hackett is.

[the audience laughs derisively at Hackett]
Well, Elmer, that's not nice. Don't you realize that Mr. Hackett is one of the biggest executives in this town?
You don't even know what a executive is!
Oh, no? An executive is a man that loses other people's money... like Mr. Hackett.
